page.title: 03Natural History
page.content: A band of carboniferous limestone runs from just north of Magor through to Rogiet and Caerwent. This greatly affects the vegetation and there are many varieties of lime loving flowers to be found on the grasslands and road verges. This year there has been an abundance of Primroses, Violets and Bluebells. In the hedgerows Cow Parsley and Red Campion can be seen everywhere. The flat grasslands to the south are divided into small fields by ditches which connect the larger channels which locally are called Reens. The Saltmarshes and mud flats of the Severn Estuary are important roosting and feeding areas for wading birds in the winter months.
